Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.AbstractButton
            • javax.swing.JButton
              • Card
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class Card
extends javax.swing.JButton
    (c) 2012 Bohde Productions Inc. All Rights Reserved. This class creates the main interface used to play the game. It contains the menus and code structure to manage the players money throughout the casino and dealing with switching games, creating games, and quitting games.
    See Also:

    • Field Detail

      • WIDTH

        public static int WIDTH
        The standard width of a card.

      • HEIGHT

        public static int HEIGHT
        The standard height of a card.

      • suit

        private java.lang.String suit
        The suit of this card.

      • faceValue

        private int faceValue
        The face value of this card. 1 for ace, 2 for deuce, etc, all the way up to 13 for a king.

      • faceShowing

        private boolean faceShowing
        Stores whether the card is flipped or not. True if the cards image is back.png, false otherwise.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(java.lang.String s,
    int fv)
        Creates a card as a JButton with an icon of the same size. The icon is appropriate image for its suit and face value.
        Parameters:
        s - the suit of the card
        fv - the face value of the card

    • Method Detail

      • flip

        public void flip()
        Flips the card. If the card is face down, icon is set to appropriate image for its suit and face value. If the card is face up, icon is set to back.png.

      • getSuit

        public java.lang.String getSuit()
        Gets the suit of this card.
        Returns:
        the suit of this card (either "hearts", "clubs", "spades", or "diamonds") as a string.

      • getFaceValue

        public int getFaceValue()
        Gets the face value of this card.
        Returns:
        The face value of this card as in integer. A two will return 2, a three will return three, etc. Aces are valued high and will return 14, not 1.

      • getFaceShowing

        public boolean getFaceShowing()
        Checks to see if the cards face is showing (if the card is face up).
        Returns:
        False if the card is face down, that is, its icon is back.png. True otherwise
